Dialogs.Dialog: Rinko
Lately, there are a lot of people who forget to return books from the library, aren't there？
Seems like it...？
You haven't noticed？ Are you taking your job as a committee member seriously？
I'm doing it. I show up on time, don't I？
It's not enough to just show up.
That's fine, but are there that many people who forget to return it？
Yeah. For those who show up at the library a lot, Rinko does warn them about it, too...
I see. If we don't do this, we'll have fewer and fewer books.
Yes！ I can't tell you how disappointed I am when I go to borrow a book and they don't have the one I'm looking for.
Okay, I'll try to think of some countermeasures.
I see, I'll leave it to you.
Rinko
Yesterday, I went to the classroom of people who didn't return books, ▲主人公＊▲.
You're a hard worker.
Because you're not there when it counts.
Sorry. So what happened？ You got them back, didn't you？
Yeah. I got them back. But the guy I was dealing with was a total jerk.
No way, did he do something to you？
Hmm. You're worried about me, at least？
...It's obvious.
Thanks. But I'm fine. I was just being sarcastic.
He said he was going to return it today, but then I said... don't lie to me.
I still think we should think of a way to change the mindset of the borrower, don't you？
I guess so.
Rinko
Um, about people forgetting to return books they've borrowed...
Did you go to get them back alone again？
Yes, but there's no end to it.
I bet a lot of people have forgotten that they borrowed one.
They don't realize that the library books belong to everyone.
Well, there was a time when I borrowed one and forgot about it for a long time...
Ouch.
That disqualifies you from being a member of the Library Committee.
Well, why don't you put up a poster or something？ If we call out to the whole school, maybe some people will remember that they borrowed one？
...I see. That's a good idea. I'll talk to my seniors about it once.
Rinko
You know, the other day, we talked about how we should make posters.
After consulting with the seniors, I put up a simple one in the hallway for now.
Yeah, I saw that too. Is the one that's posted at the entrance of the library, isn't it？
Yes.
So how is it working...？
That alone seems to be quite effective.
After school, there was a line at the return counter.
I see. That's good to hear. That solves the problem, huh？
It's not that easy. And it may only be effective now.
I see. You're a hard worker ▲小早川＊▲.
And you're an idiot. Rinko is just doing the obvious. But...
I'll try harder and get more compliments, maybe... hehe.
Rinko
The other day, a girl in my class brought homemade cookies.
Making sweets is such a girly hobby.
But, you know, all the boys were so elated, I couldn't stand to look at them.
Even my homeroom teacher is happy to eat it, so it's the end of the world.
Your homeroom teacher is a guy, right？ That's how men are, so forgive him.
It's just a cookie, you know？ Anyone can make something like that.
The fact that it's handmade is more important than the taste.
Hmm. You like that type of girl too？
Especially when they try their best to make it even though they can't.
...Why are you looking at me？ I can at least make cookies.
Rinko
You know, about the girl who baked cookies the other day...
Yeah, I bet she's popular with the boys.
Nope. Rather, popular with girls.
Why？
All the girls asked her to teach them how to make pastries. It was indeed delicious.
Hmm. That's a surprising development.
Right？ I heard they are going to make sweets at her house next time after school.
Heard？ Aren't you going ▲小早川＊▲？
...No. Rinko is not that kind of character, you know？
What a waste. I wish I could have tried the cookies made by you, ▲小早川＊▲.
...Oh, right.
Rinko
You know, I'm going to join a baking workshop.
Didn't you say you weren't going to participate the other day？
It's weird that Rinko is the only one in the class who doesn't participate.
(I'm sure the previous you would never have joined, ▲小早川＊▲...)
What？
I was thinking that I'm looking forward to the cookies you'll make ▲小早川＊▲.
Nobody said anything about feeding you.
Really！？
...I can't help it. If I fail, I'll bring them to you.
Make sure you do it right.
I'll think about it.
Rinko
Here. I've been going to the baking workshop.
From the look on your face, you must have done well. Oh, it's even wrapped properly and looks good.
...Don't open it. Don't be ridiculous.
Well, let's get a quick taste...
...Delicious.
Why do you look so surprised？
Because this could be sold in a regular store.
Hehe. Then what kind of cookies should I make next？
...Oh, cookies again？ What else but cookies？
None. Because I only know how to make cookies.
Rinko
You know that vacant lot behind the school？
Yeah. That place full of weeds and bushes.
Yeah. There was a kitten abandoned there.
Abandoned cats... I know there's been a lot of them lately, but it's a sad story.
Right？ I don't understand the nerve of abandoning such a cute girl at all.
I'm sure the owners have their own circumstances, but I wouldn't throw them away.
Yeah, so Rinko though we should keep it on campus secretly.
You okay？ The teachers will find you.
I was already found.
I knew it. So what happened？
I ran around the whole school with a kitten in my arms...
Finally, the teacher gave up and decided to cooperate in the search for the owner, and so on.
"And so on", she says...
Rinko
I heard they found someone to keep the cat.
I see. Good for you.
...Yeah.
You don't look too happy, do you？
They could leave with Rinko for a while... she was still so tiny.
Then why don't you go to the new owner's house ask them to pet her？
If you do that, you'll get attached to her and won't be able to leave her.
I see... Then we'll just have to pray from afar that the kitty is happy.
...Yeah. I hope good things come for that little girl.
Rinko
The teacher told me about that little cat. She's sick now.
What！？
The owner who abandoned her, they didn't even vaccinate her properly.
That's terrible... How is she feeling？
...They say she's not good.
If that girl... What should Rinko do？
Pull yourself together. Trust that girl, ▲小早川＊▲.
...Yes.
Don't worry. I'm sure the veterinary will take care of her.
Yeah... I guess so. Let's encourage her from afar.
Rinko
There is a cat god in this world. I'm sure of it！！
Huh？ I see, the kitty is finally cured.
Yes. I wonder if Rinko's prayer got through to the cat god.
I'm sure of it.
And then... hehe.
What's more？
I got a picture of her from her owner and she seems in good health. Geez... she's so cute.
I wish I could have a cat... I can't keep one right now, though.
Then I hope you can live with a lot of cats in the future.
In the future, huh...
Hmm？ What's wrong？
Hehe, I'm counting on you, okay？
Rinko
Hey, a question. What books have you been reading lately？
I haven't read many books...
Disqualified from the Library Committee.
What about you？ Are you reading something, ▲小早川＊▲？
These days, some German literature. I think it's about "The Sorrows of Young Heintel".
German literature, huh... What's the story？
A story about a young man who falls in love for the first time and despairs of an unfulfilled love.
I'll lend it to you when I'm done reading it.
...I don't want to fall into despair.
Rinko
You look so grim, what's wrong？
That was a heavier story than I imagined.
Oh. The Sorrows of Young Heintel, right？
The main character, a young man, falls in love with a beautiful woman who has a fiancee.
But love never comes true, and he kills himself in despair of all the consequences.
...It's a tragedy.
Hey. What do you think about love that will never come true？
I wouldn't want to, and I can't even imagine what it would be like.
I see. It's smooth sailing for you.
It's not smooth sailing, but love is coming true.
...What are you talking about, idiot？
Hey. Are you still reading that thing？ The story about Young Heintel...
Rinko
I'm worried. I'm almost there. The more I read, the more hopeless I am.
Well, there's a story about a young man who committed suicide in the same despair when it was first published.
They should have ventured into gaming before they got so worked up.
I guess there were no games at the time...
If Rinko was so desperate that she was sick of everything, what would you do...？
You wouldn't despair.
You don't know that.
I told you I'm on your side until the end, right？ You shouldn't despair.
Don't act so cool... Hehe.
Rinko
Hah...
Not enough sleep？
Yup. I stayed up all night and read it all at once.
Ah, about Young whatever. Was it interesting？
Are you going to listen only to Rinko's impressions and think you've read it？
...I was too obvious.
If you are interested, read it yourself.
...It's going to be hard to read. It's going to be painful to read about the tragedy endlessly.
This work questions the philosophy of how to live through that tragedy.
Hmm. That's a philosophy I'd like to remain ignorant of for the rest of my life.
That's usually the case. I don't like the idea of a life of tragedy...
Yes. After all, love is more fun and fulfilling when it comes true, isn't it？
...What are you grinning all by yourself？ You're an idiot.
Rinko
Hey. Do you know the rumor about the new fast food restaurant？
I didn't know. Is there gonna be a new restaurant？
Yes, I heard they are looking for part-timers now.
That's all it takes to get the word out.
They said those uniforms are cute.
I see.
Not really interested？
For the uniform itself.
Hmm. So what if Rinko wants to wear that uniform？
I'm just kidding. Don't imagine it.
Rinko
It's the fast food place I talked about the other day.
Oh, did you hear the rumors about the cute uniforms？
Yes. It was indeed cute.
You went to see it？
No way. The boys were given a flyer.
So how was it...？
Maybe it's not quite Rinko's taste.
What's the difference？ There's not that much difference in waitress uniforms.
Hmm... I'd like to see a little more substance, not just cuteness.
And punk is played all over the shop.
Sounds like a restless place...
I don't know. It's an ideal place for Rinko...
Rinko
You know Kawamura-sensei？
I remember she was a newly married teacher. She's a beautiful teacher, and when they found out she was married, a lot of boys cried...
Men are idiots...
...So what's wrong with Kawamura-sensei？
She's going on maternity leave this month.
I see. They're having a baby.
Yeah. The girls are now fussing about which one the baby will look like.
They're getting ahead of themselves. I remember her husband was stocky as a rock.
Yeah. I've seen pictures of them, but that's just Beauty and the Beast.
I wonder how you and Rinko look to those around them.
You say I'm a beast？
Who knows？ At least it's not Prince Charming on a white horse.
...Can't argue with that.
Rinko prefers a charming beast to a prince, though.
Rinko
Hey, you know, I wonder if babies are hard to raise.
They are saying she's having a hard time with childcare, so Kawamura- sensei won't be coming back that soon. Everyone's talking about it now.
Too bad if that's true, because she's very popular and a good sensei.
I know. But I also kind of understand how hard it is to raise a child.
Have you ever raised once, ▲小早川＊▲？
I have not...
Wha-what's that far？ Didn't you ever take care of your relative's kids？
Oh, I see... You know, I still have a little brother.
Come to think of it, that's true.
Normally he's cute and unruly, but once he starts crying, he's a handful. He's like a monster.
It would be even harder with a newborn infant.
Yeah. I'd like the sensei not to quit if possible, but I can't ask her to do so.
Rinko
...This is the worst. This is the biggest pinch Rinko ever had in her life.
What happened？
I'm going to give a speech in my next English class.
Doesn't that mean you were selected？
It's known that Rinko likes western music...
Oh, so that's it.
Listening and talking are completely different.
But it's been decided, right？
...You're on Rinko's side, aren't you？
Preparation aside, the speech is the real deal.
...Still sucks.
Speaking of which, what happened to your English speech？
Rinko
...It's finished.
Then you managed to recite it. I was worried.
Yup. It wasn't bad, I want to think. I was praised at least.
That's great. What did you write about？
...About our worldview, quoting Killer Bambies lyrics.
Briefly explain.
In short, I'm talking about loving Killer Bambies. When it's something you love, the words come out so smoothly.
I can kind of imagine. It's amazing when you talk about your love for cats, ▲小早川＊▲.
Okay, now tell me how much you love Rinko.
...I wonder how can I explain it easily.
I see... You don't like Rinko that much.
But why should I tell you...
I can't hear you...
(Your speech may work, but your acting doesn't...)
Rinko
The girls on the library committee decided to do a reading session.
A reading group？ Everyone gets together and reads a book？
Not exactly. They volunteer to read books to daycare children.
Why didn't they asked me？
Yeah. First of all, just girls.
Hmm. I thought you would not participate in that kind of thing, ▲小早川＊▲.
That's prejudice. It's fun to think about what kind of books the little ones would enjoy.
Come to think of it, I read to my little brother at home, too.
It makes Rinko happy to see them listening to me with sparkling eyes.
And if it makes you like books, that's a good thing.
I see. This could be a big responsibility.
Rinko
The last reading was quite well received.
Heh, good for you. What book did you read them？
At first I thought a short picture book would be good, so I decided on a picture book called "Kitsune no Okaimono".
I've never heard of it. What's the story？
A story about a little fox who goes on his first shopping trip and has many adventures. It is especially popular among boys.
The sensei and their mothers even asked me to do it again next time. Hehe.
Maybe you're suited to be a childcare worker, ▲小早川＊▲.
Is that so？ Come to think of it, I'm surprised at how young people act these days.
What do you mean？
"Do you have a boyfriend, onee-chan？" they asked me. And they were a couple of 4 years old.
4 years old, huh... So what？
I replied that I'll show them a picture of onee-chan's boyfriend next time I come over. Hehe, looking forward to it.
(I'm kind of nervous...)
